text: Meade is a city in Meade County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Meade County. In 2020, 1,505 people lived there. ==History== Meade was planned out and incorporated in 1885. It was named after Gen. George Meade. ==Geography== The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Meade has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Meade, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 1,505 people, 611 households, and 382 families living in Meade. Of the households, 69.7% owned their home and 30.3% rented their home. The median age was 42.4 years. Of the people, 86.2% were White, 1.2% were Black, 0.9% were Asian, 0.3% were Native American, 2.7% were from some other race, and 8.7% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 9.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,721 people, 670 households, and 454 families living in Meade. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Meade * Meade - Directory of Public Officials * Meade Economic Development * Meade Chamber of Commerce ;Schools * USD 226, local school district ;Historical * Photos of early Meade * Photos of Meade schools ;Maps * Meade City Map , KDOT Category:1885 establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Meade County, Kansas Category:County seats in Kansas
title: Meade, Kansas
